title: Former South Africa cricketer Gary Kirsten forgets to include Welsh Fire in tweet The Hundred Draft
text:
Former South Africa international cricketer and coach Gary Kirsten has landed himself in hot water after posting a tweet in which he forgets to include the name of his new hundred ball franchise, before quickly addressing his error.

The 51-year-old will be in charge of new hundred ball franchise Welsh Fire ahead of the new cricket format getting underway next summer.

Excitement is building as the draft will take place on Sunday to determine which players each franchise will select for the new competition. Kirsten took to Twitter to share his eagerness for the selection process.

Gary Kirsten will coach Welsh Fire ahead of next summer's The Hundred cricket competition

The South African landed himself in hot water for not tweeting the name of his new side

However, the former opening batsman neglected to include the name of his new side, instead tweeting: 'Can't wait for The Hundred Draft and to pick the [insert team name] squad on Sunday at 7pm. #TheHundredDraft'.

After being told of his error, Kirsten swiftly deleted the tweet and posted the correct version online, but fans were quick to notice his mistake.

@PhilBe9 said: 'You’ve already p***ed off the Welsh public with your deleted tweet. It’s gone viral over here. You will need to make amends by picking some Welsh players, or it could be frosty!'

The 51-year-old quickly addressed the error by deleting and re-posting the correct tweet

Meanwhile, @LankyYabba said: 'Swiftly done, swiftly done #chapeau'

The Draft for next summer's The Hundred takes place on Sunday at 7pm as the new franchises battle it out for cricket's star players signatures.
